performance_metrics.name: Event Volume Throughput
performance_metrics.description: Maximum number of security events the SIEM system can process and analyze per second.  This should account for peak load periods.

performance_metrics.name: Alert Volume
performance_metrics.description: The average number of alerts generated by the system per day. Lower values indicate effective correlation and reduced alert fatigue.

performance_metrics.name: Mean Time To Detect (MTTD)
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken to detect a security incident, from event generation to alert generation and investigation initiation.

performance_metrics.name: Mean Time To Resolve (MTTR)
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken to fully resolve a security incident, from detection to complete containment and remediation.

performance_metrics.name: Correlation Accuracy
performance_metrics.description: The percentage of alerts that are correctly correlated to represent a genuine security incident.  This is impacted by the quality of rules and the system's analytical capabilities.

performance_metrics.name: Log Ingestion Latency
performance_metrics.description: The maximum delay between a log event being generated and the SIEM system receiving and processing that log event.

implementation_requirements.name: Log Source Compatibility
implementation_requirements.specification: Must support integration with Syslog, SNMP, OPC-UA, REST APIs, and native application logs.  Supports JSON and XML log formats.
implementation_requirements.description: The system needs broad source compatibility to capture data from diverse IT infrastructure.

implementation_requirements.name: Scalability
implementation_requirements.specification: Horizontal scaling support with minimum 4 nodes in a cluster for redundant processing and data storage.
implementation_requirements.description: The system should be able to scale up to handle increasing data volumes and user loads.

implementation_requirements.name: Data Retention Policy
implementation_requirements.specification: Minimum 30 days of raw log data retention; 90 days of processed event data retention.
implementation_requirements.description: Aligns with regulatory compliance requirements and incident investigation needs.

implementation_requirements.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
implementation_requirements.specification: Multi-tiered RBAC with granular permissions control. At least 5 user roles with distinct access privileges.
implementation_requirements.description: Ensures security and compliance by limiting access based on user responsibilities.

implementation_requirements.name: API Integrations
implementation_requirements.specification: REST API for integration with SOAR platforms, ticketing systems, and vulnerability scanners.

implementation_requirements.name: Reporting and Dashboarding
implementation_requirements.specification: Pre-built dashboards for common security metrics. Ability to create custom reports.
implementation_requirements.description: Facilitates monitoring, analysis, and communication of security posture.

industry_standards: PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard)
HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)
operational_considerations: Dedicated SIEM Administrator(s): Minimum 2 full-time staff.
Regular Rule Tuning & Maintenance: Schedule monthly reviews and updates.
Threat Intelligence Integration: Subscription to a reputable threat intelligence feed.
User Training: Comprehensive training for all SIEM users.
Baseline Performance Monitoring: Continuous monitoring of system performance metrics.
